data.title: Donald Sisk Obituary - Aberdeen, Washington
data.meta_description: Donald Wayne Sisk of Montesano, Washington passed away on Thursday April 3, 2014 at Providence St. Peters Hospital in Olympia, Washington. He was 54. Donald was born February 14, 1960 in Aberdeen, Washington to Enos and Alice (Cuff) Sisk. He was raised in Aberdeen and graduated from Weatherwax High School. He also lived in Raymond, Grayland, Westport, Elma, Oakville and Arlington. In 1998 Don married Lula Hollar in Labam, Washington.  They later divorced.    Don worked at the shoe shine stand at Walt’s Barbers shop, as a cab dispatcher, Le Mays landfill/recycle and as a Traffic flagger for road construction.   Don studied with the Jehovah’s Witnesses in the past and was familiar with the resurrection hope.  Don enjoyed making craft items, playing cribbage, working puzzles, visiting with friends and neighbors and when he was healthy he enjoyed hunting, fishing, and being outdoors.   Donald is survived by his mother; Alice Sisk of Aberdeen, Washington, sister; Nancy Cronk of Sequim, his brothers; Bill James of Elma, Washington, Dennis James, of Timber Lakes, Washington and Leroy Sisk of Aberdeen, Washington, and his ex-wife Lula Hollar of Union Gap. Washington.     Don’s family would like to give a special thanks to all the staff and workers at Grays Harbor Health and Rehabilitation, and also to Barbara and all the friends and neighbors at Montesano Harbor apartments.   Flowers and cards may be sent to Donald Sisk family 1117 W. Marion, Aberdeen, Washington 98520.
data.text:
For Immediate Need

Call us at 360-533-8864

We are here to help you. If you have need of our services, please call us, day or night. Or, if you prefer, you can fill out the form on the right.

Pre-Arrange Your Funeral

Are you thinking about pre-planning your funeral? Pre-planning is the best way to choose how you're remembered, to ease the emotional and financial burden on your loved ones, to protect yourself from rising funeral costs, and to let your family know your final wishes.

Click here to learn more, or fill out this form and we will contact you.

Site Search

If you are looking for information on a particular topic, or if you are looking for a loved one who has been entrusted to our care, you can use the form below to narrow down your search.

Site Search

Order Flowers

Ordering flowers from our site ensures that your order will reach us or the family in a timely manner, and your gesture of support will remain acknowledged in the Book of Memories™ for future generations. We only work with local florists so we can maintain the sense of urgency and quality of your selections. We thank you for helping to support the family during their time of need, and will fondly remember your kind gesture.

Click Here

Order Tribute Gifts

We respect the sensitivity and dignity that comes with ordering tribute gifts from the funeral home. It is for this reason that we have attempted to design our online Sympathy Store with the utmost respect to the family and the deceased. We hope you find this service helpful during your time of need and would welcome any comments or suggestions you might have to help us serve our communities better.
